Sentece: There was no significant difference between controls and cigarette smokers in desmethyldiazepam volume of distribution (1.29 vs 1.34 liters/kg), elimination half-life (55 vs 59 h), clearance (0.284 vs 0.276 ml/min/kg), or free fraction in serum (1.96 vs 1.92% unbound).
Title: Influence of propranolol coadministration or cigarette smoking on the kinetics of desmethyldiazepam following intravenous clorazepate.
Name: Clorazepate

Sentece: There was no significant difference between controls and cigarette smokers in desmethyldiazepam volume of distribution (1.29 vs 1.34 liters/kg), elimination half-life (55 vs 59 h), clearance (0.284 vs 0.276 ml/min/kg), or free fraction in serum (1.96 vs 1.92% unbound).
Title: Influence of propranolol coadministration or cigarette smoking on the kinetics of desmethyldiazepam following intravenous clorazepate.

Sentece: Pharmacokinetic analysis of the data according to a two-compartment open model with first-order absorption indicated that the serum half-life (t0.5beta) of nordiazepam, the major biotransformation product present in serum, was about 48 hours and served as a basis for the design of a multiple-dose steady-state study.
Title: Steady-state bioavailability of two clorazepate dipotassium dosage forms.
Name: Clorazepate

Sentece: Multiple-dose administration of the tablet and divided-capsule regimen to two groups of subjects for ten days indicated each dosage form yielded similar minimum steady-state serum levels of about 0.6 micrograms/ml which plateaued following seven days of drug administration.
Title: Steady-state bioavailability of two clorazepate dipotassium dosage forms.
Name: Clorazepate

Sentece: The bioavailability was almost 100% after IM administration.

Sentece: After a single oral dose of clorazepate, maximal nordiazepam concentrations ranged from 569.6 to 1,387.9 ng/ml (mean, 880.2 +/- 248.9 ng/ml) and were detected 16.8 to 131.4 minutes (mean, 85.2 +/- 36 minutes) after dosing.
Title: Effects of a 44-day administration of phenobarbital on disposition of clorazepate in dogs.
Name: Clorazepate

Sentece: After a single oral dose of clorazepate, maximal nordiazepam concentrations ranged from 569.6 to 1,387.9 ng/ml (mean, 880.2 +/- 248.9 ng/ml) and were detected 16.8 to 131.4 minutes (mean, 85.2 +/- 36 minutes) after dosing.
Title: Effects of a 44-day administration of phenobarbital on disposition of clorazepate in dogs.
Name: Clorazepate

Sentece: After administration of phenobarbital for 44 consecutive days, maximal nordiazepam concentrations were significantly (P < 0.01) lower, ranging from 209.6 to 698.5 ng/ml (mean, 399.3 +/- 155.6 ng/ml) at 68.4 to 145.8 minutes (mean, 93 +/- 25.8 minutes) after dosing.
Title: Effects of a 44-day administration of phenobarbital on disposition of clorazepate in dogs.
Name: Clorazepate

Sentece: After administration of phenobarbital for 44 consecutive days, maximal nordiazepam concentrations were significantly (P < 0.01) lower, ranging from 209.6 to 698.5 ng/ml (mean, 399.3 +/- 155.6 ng/ml) at 68.4 to 145.8 minutes (mean, 93 +/- 25.8 minutes) after dosing.
Title: Effects of a 44-day administration of phenobarbital on disposition of clorazepate in dogs.
Name: Clorazepate

Sentece: Mean area under the curve (AUC) on day 1 (mean, 3.37 +/- 0.598 ng.min/ml) was significantly (P < 0.001) greater than AUC on day 44 (1.66 +/- 0.308 ng.min/ml).
Title: Effects of a 44-day administration of phenobarbital on disposition of clorazepate in dogs.

Name: Clorazepate

Sentece: Oral clearance was significantly (P < 0.01) greater on day 44 (12.44 +/- 2.55 ml/min/kg), compared with that on day 1 (6.16 +/- 1.35 ml/min/kg).
